title.narrative: Strategic Partnership Convening and Convincing Programme Indonesia

description.narrative: Pathway 4: Increased adherence of the private sector to the UN Guiding Principles on Business & Human Rights.
pathway 4; towards a sustainable private sector

The activities of CNV Internationaal and partner organisation Hukatan within the Indonesian Civic Engagement Alliance country programme primarily focus on the improving labour rights in the Indonesian palm oil sector. Specific lobbying themes include respect for trade union and labor rights and implementation of international labour standards and corporate social responsibility (CSR) principles at global level. CNV Internationaal provides knowledge on international labor standards and CSR principles and will deliver expertise on strategic L&A, negotiation skills, and effective social dialogue, hereby helping to ensure an enabling environment for CSOs in the program countries. In the event of systematic violation of labor rights, CNV International can mobilize CNV members, CSOs in the Netherlands and/or consumers to pressure governments or private (international) enterprises to adhere to the core labor conventions. CNV Internationaal and Hukatan are responsible for National/Jakarta, local (Kalimantan and Sumatra) level of lobby and Java as general geographical focus in coalition with ICCO Indonesia Program team.

Paid salary base on regulation (minimum wage and meals allowance), c. Implemented occupational health and safety and now starting negotiation a new CBA.
Q2: (1) 1 local palm oil company (PT. Maju Kalimantan Hadapan) implemented improvement on the labor issues.
The agreement has been made with PT Maju Kalimantan Hadapan on 15 May 2019 between management and the unions (HUKATAN and SERBUNDO) due to the demonstration and lobbied that HUKATAN did with SERBUNDO. The agreement contains of several issues that demanded by the unions and agreed by management:
1) Regarding to the Wages: It will be used minimum regional wage for casual labors. For Harvester, it will be discussed with high level management. (According to the latest monitoring, the implementation is still partials and still ongoing process).
2) Regarding to Health Insurance: All workers will be covered by social insurance/BPJS. The Management will follow up to BPJS for worker who have registered but not yet have the card. Besides that, Management will inviting BPJS to the plantation to do socialization to the workers.
3) Regarding to Clean Water: Management will providing wells in each estates. The maintenance of the well will be borne to the management. Management must also should monitor the quality of water, whether the water quality is suitable for drinking and using.
4) Regarding to CBA: The CBA draft process is still in negotiations at Union level that should be submitted to management. This CBA is initiated by HUKATAN, but in the CBA, SERBUNSO Union should also include in the CBA. Hukatan and SERBUNSO shall be involved in the CBA process and negotiation. Both trade unions shall receive the copy of signed CBA.
5) Regarding to the Unilateral Dismissal: The Management shall not dismiss the workers without comply with the labor law. The Management then reinstated the workers who have been dismissed.
